TopicTitle: So I decided to make an engine cluster with SpaceY parts.

Articles.Content:
369,600 thrust.

Under launch:

And of course burning up in the atmosphere on the way out.
#TheWhackisBack

And here's the subassembly file because why not?

http://kerbal.curseforge.com/shareables/233829-the-whackjovian-deluxe-a-proper-engine-cluster

So how come no-one else has done this?

Oh yeah - there is only one Whackjob
"Holy struts Whackman!"

Copy-pasting this here from Reddit, since it applies, given the preceeding statement.

And just a quick note to explain all the trussing and struts on the outside. The upper-mind and the lower trusses are actually connected to the engines that were rotated inside that tank. The fuel lines you can see run from that can to the trusses attached to the tanks. That's what lets the fuel flow freely to the engines from the tank stack you can put above it. And since the upper mid and lower trusses are on the engines, the upper and lower-mid trusses are attached to the tanks. The struts connect the trusses from the engines and the trusses from the tanks. That's what keeps the engines inside safely pointed DOWN, despite the hellacious amounts of thrust!

I'd rewrite it just for the forums special like but I'm in a hurry to be ready for the office.

The whole "blowing up in atmosphere" is clearly caused by going too fast, too low. Some people would suggest madness like throttling down or "less boosters", when clearly the solution is more payload.

... I *think* I know of a way to stagger them in a different sort of way, that would allow me to fit in more. Double I'm certain I could do. Maaaybe triple. We'll see.

Really nice but I suggest white fuel lines from the Colorful Fuel Lines mod.

Figured out a way to build an engine cluster that has 1,478,400 thrust. Problem is I half-arsed it and the reinforcement isn't enough. So I have to redo it. Test launches had it shred the second it left the pad. Too much go-juice for an imperfect truss cage job.

So I will do it again.

The whole "blowing up in atmosphere" is clearly caused by going too fast, too low. Some people would suggest madness like throttling down or "less boosters", when clearly the solution is more payload.

Not reinforced anywhere near enough. Kraken shreds it right on the pad. I can fix it. I can make it work.

... but later. I should be sleeping now. I'll take another Whack at it. I promise.
